p: As a result of scaling up malaria control efforts, between 2000 and 2015, the world saw an estimated 37% reduction in incidence and a 60% decline in mortality rates [ 41], thus realising Millennium Development Goal (MDG) 6. However, the WHA target to reduce the global burden of malaria by 75% by 2015 [ 42] and the RBM target to reduce deaths to near zero by the end of 2015 have not been attained [ 43]. In 2017, there were 219 million cases of malaria globally, 92% of them in Africa, of which 99% were Plasmodium falciparum where the incidence rate in 2016 was 206 cases per 1,000 population at risk [ 5].
